name: Beardsley, R. Duncan
title: Unknown
notes: Listed in leaked Bohemian Grove membership lists as a member of the Bella Union camp. No substantial public biographical information found.

name: Davidow, William H.
title: Co-Founder and General Partner
notes: Bill Davidow is a Silicon Valley pioneer who served as senior VP at Intel (1973-1985) and co-founded Mohr Davidow Ventures in 1985. He is the author of five books including 'Marketing High Technology' and 'The Autonomous Revolution.' He holds a PhD in electrical engineering from Stanford and a BS summa cum laude from Dartmouth. He served on the Caltech Board of Trustees.
political_donations: Mohr Davidow Ventures has OpenSecrets org profile

name: DeFeo, Neil P.
title: Executive Partner and Co-Founder
notes: Neil P. DeFeo spent 25 years at Procter & Gamble before becoming CEO of Remington Products (1997-2003), then Chairman/President/CEO of Playtex Products (2004-2007), and CEO of The Sun Products Corporation (2008-2011). He co-founded Nonantum Capital Partners in 2018. He has an electrical engineering degree from Manhattan College.

name: Dossee, David W.

name: Garfield, Bob
title: Contributing Opinion Editor (formerly Co-Host, On the Media)
notes: Bob Garfield is an American journalist and media critic who co-hosted NPR's On the Media from 2001 until he was fired by WNYC in 2021 for alleged bullying. He was the advertising columnist for Advertising Age from 1985-2010 and contributed to All Things Considered. He is the author of 'The Chaos Scenario.' He joined the San Francisco Chronicle as contributing opinion editor in September 2023.

name: Grant, James C.
title: Founder and Editor
notes: James Grant is a financial journalist and publisher who founded Grant's Interest Rate Observer in 1983, a twice-monthly financial journal. He previously worked at the Baltimore Sun and Barron's, and has authored multiple books on financial history including 'The Forgotten Depression' (2014 Hayek Prize winner). He is a Phi Beta Kappa alumnus of Indiana University with an MA from Columbia.

name: Keogh, James M.
title: Director (former); former Executive Editor, Time magazine
notes: James M. Keogh (1916-2006) was executive editor of Time magazine (1961-1968), then served as chief speechwriter for President Nixon and later as Director of the U.S. Information Agency (1973-1977). A Nebraska native and Creighton University graduate, he authored 'This Is Nixon' and 'President Nixon and the Press.' He died in Greenwich, CT at age 89.

name: Linfield, Michael
title: Judge (ret.); Attorney
notes: Michael Linfield earned a BA from UCLA and graduated magna cum laude from Harvard Law School in 1989. He served as West Coast Director of the J.P. Stevens Boycott and as UFW lobbyist before entering private practice. Gov. Gray Davis appointed him to the Los Angeles Superior Court in 2003. He authored 'Freedom Under Fire: U.S. Civil Liberties in Times of War' (1990).

name: McLaughlin, David T.
employer: American Red Cross (former Chairman); Aspen Institute (former President/CEO)
title: President Emeritus, Dartmouth College
notes: David T. McLaughlin (1932-2004) was the 14th President of Dartmouth College (1981-1987), president/CEO of The Toro Company (1970-1981), and president/CEO of the Aspen Institute (1988-1997). He chaired the American Red Cross 2001-2004, overseeing post-9/11 relief. He held a Dartmouth AB and Tuck MBA (1954/1955).

name: Neuffer, Richard A.
title: Vice Chairman
notes: Richard A. Neuffer serves as Vice Chairman at Enviri Corp (formerly Harsco Corporation), a Philadelphia-based environmental services and industrial solutions company. Limited public biographical details available.

name: Pritzker, Donald N.
title: President, Hyatt Hotels
notes: Donald Nicholas Pritzker (1932-1972) was a member of the prominent Chicago Pritzker family and served as President of Hyatt Hotels, credited with setting the culture and philosophy of the chain and growing it to the 5th largest in the world. He graduated from Harvard College and the University of Chicago Law School. He died at 39 of a heart attack in Honolulu. His daughter is Penny Pritzker, 38th U.S. Secretary of Commerce.

name: Robinson, T. Bruce
title: Chairman; former U.S. Ambassador to Canada
notes: T. Bruce Robinson (Paul H. Robinson Jr., born 1930) served as the U.S. Ambassador to Canada under President Reagan (1981-1985) before that he headed Robinson, Incorporated, a broker for banks and professional institutions in group insurance. A lifelong Republican, he was finance chairman of Reagan's 1979-80 Illinois primary campaign.

name: Sommers, Albert T.
title: Chief Economist (former)
notes: Albert T. Sommers was chief economist at The Conference Board, a leading business research organization. He authored 'The U.S. Economy Demystified: What the Major Economic Statistics Mean and Their Significance for Business' (with Lucie R. Blau, 1985/1988) and 'Inflation, the Crucial Challenge in the 1980s.' He was a prominent voice on economic policy through the 1980s.

name: Speights, Robert E.
title: President, Industrial Services
notes: Robert E. Speights joined Clean Harbors in 2018 as President of Industrial Services after serving as SVP/Chief Sales Officer at Aegion Corporation. He has over 20 years in executive sales and operations in industrial services including roles at Transfield Services, Aquilex/Hydrochem, MPW Industrial, and Dowell/Schlumberger.

name: Whittlesey, Faith Ryan
title: Former U.S. Ambassador to Switzerland; former White House Assistant to the President
notes: Faith Ryan Whittlesey (1939-2018) served twice as U.S. Ambassador to Switzerland under President Reagan (1981-1983, 1985-1988) and as Assistant to the President for Public Liaison (1983-1985). A Pennsylvania Republican politician and attorney, she served in the PA House of Representatives. For 19 years she was President and Chairman of the Board of the American Swiss Foundation. She died May 21, 2018, aged 79.
ngos: American Swiss Foundation (President and Chairman, then Chairman Emeritus)

name: Wulff, John
title: Former Chairman, Hercules Inc.; Former CFO, Union Carbide
notes: John K. Wulff served as CFO of Union Carbide Corporation (1995-2001) after 14 years at the company in various finance roles. He was previously a Partner at KPMG (1977-1987). He later served as Chairman of Hercules Incorporated (2003-2008) and has served on multiple corporate boards. He is a member of the Financial Executives International Hall of Fame.

name: Wyatt, Oscar S. Jr.
title: Founder and Chairman (ret.), Coastal Corporation
notes: Oscar Shelby Wyatt Jr. (1924-2025) was a Texas oil tycoon who founded Coastal States Gas Producing Company in 1955, which grew into the Fortune 500 Coastal Corporation. He retired as chairman in 1997 when Coastal merged with El Paso Natural Gas. A WWII B-24 pilot with the Distinguished Flying Cross, he pled guilty in 2007 to one count of wire fraud related to illegal Oil-for-Food payments to Saddam Hussein and served approximately one year in federal prison. He died October 8, 2025, aged 101.
political_donations: Made political contributions; known for significant anonymous donations to various causes including police officers' families.

name: Acquistapace, James S.
title: President and CEO (former owner)
notes: James (Jim) S. Acquistapace was the longtime President/CEO of Davis Instruments, a Hayward, California-based manufacturer of precision weather, marine, and environmental instruments. Under his leadership Davis became a leading provider of weather stations for agronomists, meteorologists, and municipalities worldwide. The company was acquired by Union Park Capital in July 2019.

name: Callas, John
title: Project Manager, Mars Exploration Rover Program (ret.)
notes: John L. Callas was the Project Manager of NASA's Mars Exploration Rover project (Spirit and Opportunity) from March 2006 until the program ended in September 2019. He joined JPL in 1989 and worked on seven Mars missions. He holds a BS from Tufts (1981) and MS/PhD in Physics from Brown University (1983/1987). He also teaches mathematics at Pasadena City College.

name: Cassin, Brendan M.
title: Chairman
notes: Brendan Joseph Cassin is a Silicon Valley venture capitalist of nearly 30 years who serves as Chairman of Capella Photonics (optical networking technology). He is the Founder and Chairman of the Cassin Educational Initiative Foundation (est. 2000), which establishes college-prep middle and high schools in economically challenged communities. He served as Chairman of the Board of Trustees of Saint Mary's College of California (1995-1999). He graduated from Holy Cross and resides in Los Altos Hills, CA.
ngos: Cassin Educational Initiative Foundation (Founder and Chairman); Saint Mary's College of California Board of Trustees (former Chairman)

name: Delattre, Edwin J.
title: Dean Emeritus, School of Education; Professor of Philosophy Emeritus
notes: Edwin J. Delattre (1941-2019) was Dean of Boston University's School of Education and Professor of Philosophy, retiring in 2006. He authored 'Character and Cops: Ethics in Policing' (AEI Press, 1989), which ran to six editions and became standard reading at law enforcement academies worldwide. He served on the National Advisory Board of the Fund for the Improvement of Postsecondary Education and was vice chair of the National Council for the National Endowment for the Humanities.
ngos: National Advisory Board, Fund for the Improvement of Postsecondary Education (Chair); National Endowment for the Humanities National Council (Vice Chair); Massachusetts Board of Education; US Naval Postgraduate School Advisory Board

name: Dullea, Henrik N.
title: Vice President for University Relations Emeritus
notes: Henrik N. Dullea served as Cornell University's VP for University Relations (1991-2003) under Presidents Rhodes and Rawlings. Before Cornell, he served as Director of State Operations for Governor Mario Cuomo (1983-1991). He holds a BA from Cornell (1961) and a PhD in political science from Syracuse University (1982). He was appointed to the SUNY Board of Trustees by Gov. Andrew Cuomo in 2012.
ngos: SUNY Board of Trustees (member); Citizens' Committee for an Effective Constitution; Tompkins County Public Library (Board President); Kendal at Ithaca Inc. (Board Director)

name: Gafni, Mordechi P.
title: President and Co-Founder
notes: Marc (Mordechai) Gafni (born 1960) is an American philosopher and former rabbi who co-founded the Center for Integral Wisdom with Ken Wilber. He holds a doctorate from Oxford's Wolfson College. His career has been marked by serious and repeated allegations of sexual and emotional abuse spanning three decades; his rabbinical ordinations have been revoked and major institutions have severed ties with him.
ngos: Center for Integral Wisdom (Co-Founder and President)

name: Henderson, James R.
title: Chairman and CEO (ret.)
notes: James A. Henderson (born c. 1934) was Chairman and CEO of Cummins Inc. (1994-1999), having joined the Columbus, Indiana engine manufacturer in 1964. A Princeton AB and Harvard Business School MBA graduate, he served in the U.S. Navy before joining Cummins. He served as a director of AT&T (1999-2007), Ameritech, International Paper, Rohm & Haas, and Hillenbrand Inc.

name: Hoyt, John L.
employer: Humane Society of the United States (HSUS)
title: President and CEO Emeritus
notes: John A. Hoyt (1932-2012) was President and CEO of the Humane Society of the United States from 1970 to 1996, during which time HSUS membership grew from 100,000 to over 5 million. An ordained Baptist minister, he transformed HSUS from a local animal welfare organization into a national force influencing legislation. He remained a director of the HSUS-affiliated Interfaith Council for the Protection of Animals and Nature after his retirement.
ngos: Humane Society of the United States (President/CEO); Interfaith Council for the Protection of Animals and Nature (Director)

name: Moody, Jim
title: Former U.S. Congressman (D-WI); former President/CEO of InterAction
notes: Jim Moody (1935-2019) was a Wisconsin Democratic congressman (1983-1993) representing Milwaukee's 5th district, serving on the Ways and Means Committee. A PhD economist from UC Berkeley with a Haverford BA and Harvard MPA, he served in the Peace Corps in Pakistan and Bangladesh. He became VP/CFO of the UN's International Fund for Agricultural Development (1995-1997) then President/CEO of InterAction, a coalition of 165 international NGOs (1997 until his death).
ngos: InterAction (President/CEO); International Fund for Agricultural Development/IFAD (VP/CFO); National Iranian American Council Advisory Board
political_donations: Democratic politician; served five terms in Congress.

name: Ohman, Jack R.
title: Contributing Opinion Editor; Editorial Cartoonist
notes: Jack Ohman (born September 1, 1960) is a Pulitzer Prize-winning editorial cartoonist (2016). He worked at the Columbus Dispatch, Detroit Free Press, and The Oregonian (1983-2012) before joining the Sacramento Bee (2013-2023). He joined the San Francisco Chronicle as contributing opinion editor in September 2023. He became the youngest nationally syndicated American cartoonist in history at age 19.

name: Tasker, Peter N.
title: Co-Founder and Strategist
notes: Peter Tasker is a British-born financial strategist and author based in Tokyo, Japan. He was ranked Japan's #1 equity strategist by Nikkei Newspaper for five consecutive years while at Dresdner Kleinwort Wasserstein. In 1998 he co-founded Arcus Investment Management, focused on Japanese equities. He is the author of 'Inside Japan' (1987) and a series of Tokyo noir fiction novels, and a columnist for the Financial Times and Bloomberg.
